summary: The Offshore Energy Security Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of the Interior to conduct at least 20 offshore oil and gas lease sales over a 10-year period in the Gulf of Mexico, with specific deadlines established. The bill defines the parameters for these sales, including acreage offered and reference to previous sale stipulations. It also includes provisions to expedite the leasing process, limiting the impact of environmental litigation and extending the moratorium on oil and gas leasing in certain areas of the Gulf of Mexico and the South Atlantic and Straits of Florida Planning Areas. The bill further provides exceptions for environmental conservation purposes.
